com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.mvc

Interface Controller

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractController, AccessTokenController, ChangePasswordController, ForgotPasswordController, FormController, IdSiteController, IdSiteLogoutController, IdSiteResultController, LoginController, LogoutController, RegisterController, VerifyController

    public interface Controller
    Simple MVC Controller concept used by Stormpath components. This allows Stormpath to work in any MVC environment (Servlet, Spring MVC, etc) by using its own concept - a simple adapter just needs to be created for each actual runtime environment.

    This ensures that Stormpath request processing and view rendering logic is identical (and testable/verifiable) across any/all supported MVC runtime environments where Stormpath may be deployed.

    Since:
    1.0.RC4

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ViewModel handleRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Processes a view request (either to render or handle submission) and returns a ViewModel that represents the resulting view to be rendered.

    • Method Detail

      • handleRequest

        ViewModel handleRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                 throws Exception
        Processes a view request (either to render or handle submission) and returns a ViewModel that represents the resulting view to be rendered. A null return value indicates that the controller implementation handled the response and committed to it directly (setting status codes, writing directly to the response output stream), etc.
        Parameters:
        request - inbound request.
        response - outbound response.
        Returns:
        a View the view to be rendered or null if the response was handled (and committed) directly.
        Throws:
        Exception
